.definition: create by putting components or members together
.example: After his first band failed, he put together a second orchestra.

.definition: to care for someone or something/yourself; to be careful about something
.example: Who will take care of the children?

.definition: to believe something is true or will happen because it seems so likely
.example: People take for granted what she does.

.definition: to use someone or something for a particular purpose, especially one that brings a benefit to you
.example: We might as well make use of the hotel's facilities.

.definition: a few days ago
.example: I only heard this the other day.

.definition: to go straightly to
.example: Meanwhile, he decided to head to the hospital.

.definition: nearly, almost
.example: The decorating is as good as finished - I just need to finish off the painting.

.definition: permanently
.example: The experience almost frightened me away for good

.definition: to consider something when making a plan or calculation
.example: We have to allow for the possibility that we might not finish on schedule.

.definition: to write in (blanks, etc.) complete by writing in
.example: The victim filled in what was stolen.

.definition: to escape from a person or place
.example: "Get away from me", Yuki said to the growling dog.

.definition: in scientific explanation
.example: Once we understand this we can shape our world in any way we want.In theory".

.definition: during the time before something happens or before a specified period ends
.example: He can work when he's feeling better, in the meantime, he should rest.

.definition: be quiet; stop speaking; stop speaking
.example: Nicole kept telling Teb to turn down his stereo. Finally, he got angry and said "shut up"

.definition: to reach the same quality or standard as someone or something else
.example: He was off school for a while and is finding it hard to catch up.

.definition: the state of being necessary
.example: You just hope that the money goes to those who are most in need

.definition: consider something when making decision
.example: We did not take account of the paperwork.

.definition: Something along those lines; something similar to that.
.example: He said he had a meeting to go to or something like that.

.definition: used to identify the specific topic that is being talked about
.example: I’m hopeless when it comes to goodbyes.

.definition: in spite of something; considering how much or little
.example: For all his money, he does not seem very happy.

.definition: an issue involving something
.example: It’s a question of trust.

.definition: for the rest of a person's life
.example: And he stayed there for life.

.definition: used to describe a person or thing in a way that is partly true but not completely or exactly
.example: I have a biology question for you - I hear you're something of an expert.

.definition: something that is different from what is usual or expected
.example: I do play the odd jazz tune.

.definition: used for emphasizing that someone or something is not at all important or impressive
.example: The ancient canal is now little more than a muddy ditch.

.definition: used for offering something to someone or inviting them to do something
.example: Would you like some cake?

.definition: to indicate that what you are saying applies to the feature you have just mentioned or to many features of something
.example: In this respect, our study refutes earlier research.

.definition: if, or only if
.example: He's welcome to come along, provided that he behaves himself.

.definition: to make an attempt at (doing something)
.example: Why don’t you have a go?

.definition: for now
.example: For the moment things seem stable.

.definition: If you do one thing at the expense of another, doing the first thing harms the second thing
.example: He had no need to protect their reputation at the expense of his own.

.definition: to indicate nonspecific things that are similar or somehow related to those being listed or discussed
.example: He does karate and things like that, you see.

.definition: very little in size or amount
.example: It was of little relevance, really.

.definition: used to indicate the time or date from which something starts.
.example: I'm out of a job as of now

.definition: gradually
.example: It might change over time.

.definition: to seem
.example: It would appear nobody on board the aircraft actually had a licence to fly it.

.definition: considered  in a particular way
.example: Beaches are thought of as vacation spots.

.definition: eager to prevent or put an end to; disapproving of or disagreeing with.
.example: He’s strangely opposed to gun control.

.definition: the basic level of practical knowledge and judgment that we all need to help us live in a reasonable and safe way
.example: Windsurfing is perfectly safe as long as you have some common sense.

.definition: to make the effort to do something
.example: It peeves me that she didn't bother to phone.

.definition: to prove something is right
.example: I have proof to back up my story.

.definition: to visit a person or a place
.example: I'll go round later and see how he is.

.definition: The entirety (of something); all (of something)
.example: Why don’t we just forget the whole thing?

.definition: at a time in the past but not now
.example: At one time I thought that too.

.definition: in one way, from one point of view
.example: In a sense, the book's story stands as a metaphor for the American dream.

.definition: usually
.example: On average, a person’s income is highest when they are in their mid-50s.

.definition: a way of dealing with or avoiding a problem
.example: There's no way round this problem.

.definition: Used to say that you know something after you see it, touch it or hear it, recognise it, you can recognise the difference, change, characteristic or particularity
.example: You can tell from the markings.

.definition: released or removed from
.example: I dream of a life free from stress.

.definition: and that sort of thing; and so on.
.example: I like art and all that.

.definition: used for making description sound less definite
.example: The party was a smash as it were.

.definition: used for asking what action to take if a particular thing should happen
.example: What if our plane is delayed and we can’t make the connection?
